payload.content: Humans will still desire to work, defined as creating, sharing, and receiving recognition and currency for their contributions, as it is a fundamental aspect of human nature.

content: Humans will still desire to work, defined as creating, sharing, and receiving recognition and currency for their contributions, as it is a fundamental aspect of human nature.

payload.content: The author is more concerned about the future of creative work in an AI-driven world than the automation of industrial factory-style work.

name: The author is more concerned about the future of creative work in an AI-driven w
content: The author is more concerned about the future of creative work in an AI-driven world than the automation of industrial factory-style work.

payload.content: If struggle, status, and curiosity are the generators of meaning, and AGI promises to eliminate these, humanity faces a dilemma regarding meaning.

name: If struggle, status, and curiosity are the generators of meaning, and AGI promis
content: If struggle, status, and curiosity are the generators of meaning, and AGI promises to eliminate these, humanity faces a dilemma regarding meaning.

payload.content: Meaning has become a scarce good in contemporary society.

name: Meaning has become a scarce good in contemporary society.
content: Meaning has become a scarce good in contemporary society.

payload.content: Reality develops toward greater complexity over time, and when complexity becomes too high, a new ordered structure must emerge.

name: Reality develops toward greater complexity over time, and when complexity become
content: Reality develops toward greater complexity over time, and when complexity becomes too high, a new ordered structure must emerge.

payload.content: Societal evolution can be analyzed through two lenses: 1) the techno-economic base (dominant mode of production and technology) and 2) the dominant worldview and value structure (meaning-making system).

name: Societal evolution can be analyzed through two lenses: 1) the techno-economic ba
content: Societal evolution can be analyzed through two lenses: 1) the techno-economic base (dominant mode of production and technology) and 2) the dominant worldview and value structure (meaning-making system).

payload.content: The evolution of techno-economic bases includes Foraging, Horticultural, Agrarian, Industrial, Informational, and potentially Intelligence.

name: The evolution of techno-economic bases includes Foraging, Horticultural, Agraria
content: The evolution of techno-economic bases includes Foraging, Horticultural, Agrarian, Industrial, Informational, and potentially Intelligence.

payload.content: The evolution of dominant worldviews and value structures includes Premodern, Modern, Postmodern, and potentially Metamodern.

name: The evolution of dominant worldviews and value structures includes Premodern, Mo
content: The evolution of dominant worldviews and value structures includes Premodern, Modern, Postmodern, and potentially Metamodern.

payload.content: Premodern societies were characterized by meaning given by higher powers (elders, scriptures, kings, priests), conformity, and a lack of individual agency.

name: Premodern societies were characterized by meaning given by higher powers (elders
content: Premodern societies were characterized by meaning given by higher powers (elders, scriptures, kings, priests), conformity, and a lack of individual agency.

payload.content: The techno-economic base of a society creates the conditions for a new level of worldview and value system to emerge at scale.

name: The techno-economic base of a society creates the conditions for a new level of
content: The techno-economic base of a society creates the conditions for a new level of worldview and value system to emerge at scale.

payload.content: Industrial society enabled the modern worldview, which valued rationality, discovered meaning through reason, science, and evidence, and replaced tradition with progress and birthright with merit.

name: Industrial society enabled the modern worldview, which valued rationality, disco
content: Industrial society enabled the modern worldview, which valued rationality, discovered meaning through reason, science, and evidence, and replaced tradition with progress and birthright with merit.

payload.content: The modern era led to several negative consequences: overemphasis on productivity, disconnection from community, replacement of spiritual frameworks with a mechanical universe model, and outsourcing of agency to institutions.

name: The modern era led to several negative consequences: overemphasis on productivit
content: The modern era led to several negative consequences: overemphasis on productivity, disconnection from community, replacement of spiritual frameworks with a mechanical universe model, and outsourcing of agency to institutions.

payload.content: Meaningless work became the sole focus and means of survival, leading to a situation where many people will face a rude awakening when AI automates this type of work.

name: Meaningless work became the sole focus and means of survival, leading to a situa
content: Meaningless work became the sole focus and means of survival, leading to a situation where many people will face a rude awakening when AI automates this type of work.

payload.content: The Information Age, driven by computers, further abstracted labor, shifting work to desks and relying on machines for heavy lifting.

name: The Information Age, driven by computers, further abstracted labor, shifting wor
content: The Information Age, driven by computers, further abstracted labor, shifting work to desks and relying on machines for heavy lifting.

payload.content: Postmodernism's key insight is aperspectivalism, the idea that no perspective is privileged, and all views are situated, partial, and contextual.

name: Postmodernism's key insight is aperspectivalism, the idea that no perspective is
content: Postmodernism's key insight is aperspectivalism, the idea that no perspective is privileged, and all views are situated, partial, and contextual.

payload.content: Agency is becoming a core survival skill in the current environment.

name: Agency is becoming a core survival skill in the current environment.
content: Agency is becoming a core survival skill in the current environment.

payload.content: An individual's unique perspective may be the only thing AGI cannot replace, serving as a competitive edge in creative work.

name: An individual's unique perspective may be the only thing AGI cannot replace, ser
content: An individual's unique perspective may be the only thing AGI cannot replace, serving as a competitive edge in creative work.

payload.content: While postmodernism correctly identified that no perspective is absolute, it incorrectly concluded that no perspective is better, leading to a contradiction where claiming all perspectives are equally valid is itself a value ranking.

name: While postmodernism correctly identified that no perspective is absolute, it inc
content: While postmodernism correctly identified that no perspective is absolute, it incorrectly concluded that no perspective is better, leading to a contradiction where claiming all perspectives are equally valid is itself a value ranking.

content: Creatives are the 'meaning-architects' of society, and their displacement by AI could lead to catastrophic results.

payload.content: Some perspectives are, in fact, better than others.

name: Some perspectives are, in fact, better than others.
content: Some perspectives are, in fact, better than others.

payload.content: The current period is characterized by chaos, necessitating the emergence of a new structure, in which individuals can play a role in shaping the future.

content: The current period is characterized by chaos, necessitating the emergence of a new structure, in which individuals can play a role in shaping the future.

payload.content: The evolution of meaning has progressed from "Up There" (Gods) to "Out There" (productivity/progress) to "Nowhere" (supposed equality), with the next stage potentially being "In Here."

name: The evolution of meaning has progressed from "Up There" (Gods) to "Out There" (p
content: The evolution of meaning has progressed from "Up There" (Gods) to "Out There" (productivity/progress) to "Nowhere" (supposed equality), with the next stage potentially being "In Here."

payload.content: Productivity is no longer a reliable source of identity.

name: Productivity is no longer a reliable source of identity.
content: Productivity is no longer a reliable source of identity.

name: Taste will be a core skill in the future, requiring the ability to differentiate
content: Taste will be a core skill in the future, requiring the ability to differentiate and exclude, asserting that one thing is better than another.

payload.content: Meaning, certainty, and security are currently at all-time lows.

content: Meaning, certainty, and security are currently at all-time lows.

payload.content: To understand the future and avoid disadvantage, one must understand the emerging techno-economic base (artificial intelligence), as it shapes the next worldview, values, and actions.

name: To understand the future and avoid disadvantage, one must understand the emergin
content: To understand the future and avoid disadvantage, one must understand the emerging techno-economic base (artificial intelligence), as it shapes the next worldview, values, and actions.

payload.content: AI is hyped to remove all labor and provide necessities, ending scarcity.

name: AI is hyped to remove all labor and provide necessities, ending scarcity.
content: AI is hyped to remove all labor and provide necessities, ending scarcity.

payload.content: The way AI removes labor increases the scarcity of meaning, as many people derive meaning from certain types of labor.

content: The way AI removes labor increases the scarcity of meaning, as many people derive meaning from certain types of labor.

payload.content: David Shapiro's Post Labor Economics is a useful theory for understanding the future economic landscape.

name: David Shapiro's Post Labor Economics is a useful theory for understanding the fu
content: David Shapiro's Post Labor Economics is a useful theory for understanding the future economic landscape.

payload.content: Companies find the idea of machines doing all work enticing because humans are expensive, complicated, emotional, and legally risky.

content: Companies find the idea of machines doing all work enticing because humans are expensive, complicated, emotional, and legally risky.

payload.content: Once AI and robots surpass humans in 'better, faster, cheaper, safer' for a given job, it will become economically irrational to employ humans for that work.

content: Once AI and robots surpass humans in 'better, faster, cheaper, safer' for a given job, it will become economically irrational to employ humans for that work.

payload.content: The replacement of human labor by AI is analogous to historical technological advancements like the hoe replacing the digging stick, or industrial machines replacing the plow, each increasing the power and potential of individuals utilizing the new tools.

content: The replacement of human labor by AI is analogous to historical technological advancements like the hoe replacing the digging stick, or industrial machines replacing the plow, each increasing the power and potential of individuals utilizing the new tools.

payload.content: A major problem with AI replacing all jobs is that if people are fired, they lack money to buy goods, leading to economic collapse.

content: A major problem with AI replacing all jobs is that if people are fired, they lack money to buy goods, leading to economic collapse.

payload.content: The three primary ways households acquire money are wages, transfers (e.g., UBI, Social Security), and capital income (e.g., dividends, rent).

content: The three primary ways households acquire money are wages, transfers (e.g., UBI, Social Security), and capital income (e.g., dividends, rent).

payload.content: If wages collapse, transfers and capital income must bear the economic burden, but transfers alone create political instability and lose price signals, making them an insufficient overall solution.

name: If wages collapse, transfers and capital income must bear the economic burden, b
content: If wages collapse, transfers and capital income must bear the economic burden, but transfers alone create political instability and lose price signals, making them an insufficient overall solution.

content: One potential solution to economic shifts caused by AI is broadening capital participation, allowing regular people to own income-generating assets.

payload.content: Many people, especially creatives, will still desire to work and be acknowledged for their contributions, even if basic needs are met.

content: Many people, especially creatives, will still desire to work and be acknowledged for their contributions, even if basic needs are met.

payload.content: Meaning was once earned, then deconstructed, and now must be generated.

content: Meaning was once earned, then deconstructed, and now must be generated.

payload.content: Meaning in life can be derived from personal and professional growth, which requires agency, and a shift of money from a productivity metric to an expression of agency is a desirable path.

content: Meaning in life can be derived from personal and professional growth, which requires agency, and a shift of money from a productivity metric to an expression of agency is a desirable path.

payload.content: To avoid outsourcing agency to machines, individuals must accept their role as creators, tool builders, explorers, and problem solvers.

content: To avoid outsourcing agency to machines, individuals must accept their role as creators, tool builders, explorers, and problem solvers.

name: Jobs that may persist despite superior automation include high-liability roles,
content: Jobs that may persist despite superior automation include high-liability roles, statutory positions, experience economy roles (e.g., bartenders, artists), meaning makers, and relationship/trust jobs (e.g., sales, diplomacy).

content: Humans will pay a premium for roles in the experience economy and meaning-making.

payload.content: Meaninglessness stems from two primary sources: stagnation (leading to chaos) and isolation (lack of connection).

content: Meaninglessness stems from two primary sources: stagnation (leading to chaos) and isolation (lack of connection).

name: The two pillars of meaning are the feeling of forward movement (progress) and a
content: The two pillars of meaning are the feeling of forward movement (progress) and a connection to something greater than oneself (contribution).

payload.content: Historically, progress was outsourced to employers and connection to divine authority, but now both are in individual hands.

name: Historically, progress was outsourced to employers and connection to divine auth
content: Historically, progress was outsourced to employers and connection to divine authority, but now both are in individual hands.

content: Progress and contribution are activated through creative problem-solving: setting an aim, identifying problems, experimenting for solutions, and sharing value with others.

payload.content: Individuals must become creators, build their own things, take their own paths, and express their agency rather than waiting for external solutions.

content: Individuals must become creators, build their own things, take their own paths, and express their agency rather than waiting for external solutions.

content: Beyond the two pillars of meaning (progress and contribution), there are three generators: Struggle (engine of progress, defining purpose), Curiosity (direction of progress, non-linear attention), and Status (proof of contribution, recognition).

content: Authentic stories will command a premium price because the human brain is a story engine that makes sense of the world through narratives.

content: Tasks requiring speed, accuracy, or utility should be left to machines, but humans crave the potential for failure, lessons, story, drama, novelty, myth, and meaning, especially during leisure.

content: An entire economy will be built around human cravings for story, drama, novelty, myth, and meaning, and its construction has already begun.

content: The Creator Economy is synonymous with the Meaning Economy, where individuals are paid by people who believe in their work and want to see more of it.

content: Attention is the scarce resource that creatives will compete for in the Creator Economy.

content: The misconception that the creator economy is a winner-takes-all battleground is false; many individuals with small followings can achieve financial well-being by sharing meaningful content.

payload.content: The influx of AI-generated 'slop' content is beneficial because it makes it easier for quality content to stand out, as instantly generated content becomes instantly worthless.

content: The influx of AI-generated 'slop' content is beneficial because it makes it easier for quality content to stand out, as instantly generated content becomes instantly worthless.

payload.content: Smart people are often biased to the domains they are smart in, which is quite an unproductive way of thinking.

content: Smart people are often biased to the domains they are smart in, which is quite an unproductive way of thinking.

content: Once a piece of content becomes "popular," people who identify as anti-mainstream immediately find a reason to hate it.

payload.content: Skills are being abstracted up a layer.

content: Skills are being abstracted up a layer.

name: The manual task of typing words or adding brush strokes still matters because co
content: The manual task of typing words or adding brush strokes still matters because compiling everything into a chat input removes agency for work demanding a personal touch, but these tasks don't matter as much as the mind of the artist doing them.

payload.content: The Swap Test: If you could swap the creator and the creation would be just as valuable, then AI can replace it. If the creation only works because you made it, then that's your edge, as it carries your perspective, situation, and taste.

name: The Swap Test: If you could swap the creator and the creation would be just as v
content: The Swap Test: If you could swap the creator and the creation would be just as valuable, then AI can replace it. If the creation only works because you made it, then that's your edge, as it carries your perspective, situation, and taste.

payload.content: Certain types of work have an objective floor, meaning AI is perfectly fine for tasks like writing documentation, summarizing information, or clarifying instructions, especially when speed and efficiency matter over voice.

content: Certain types of work have an objective floor, meaning AI is perfectly fine for tasks like writing documentation, summarizing information, or clarifying instructions, especially when speed and efficiency matter over voice.

payload.content: When writing involves a personal essay about grief or an article arguing a specific viewpoint, the author's unique point of view, which is a culmination of beliefs, ideas, and experiences, is crucial and cannot be replicated.

name: When writing involves a personal essay about grief or an article arguing a speci
content: When writing involves a personal essay about grief or an article arguing a specific viewpoint, the author's unique point of view, which is a culmination of beliefs, ideas, and experiences, is crucial and cannot be replicated.

content: AI cannot think from your perspective, replicate your energy signature, perform genuine sensemaking, or have a trajectory or evolving taste.

payload.content: AI can copy anything, but it cannot copy what happens next until it has already happened.

content: AI can copy anything, but it cannot copy what happens next until it has already happened.

content: A creative's perspective is always evolving, so by the time AI copies them, they have already moved on.

content: What is considered "great work" is a moving target that evolves with society and culture, and for creatives, the act of discovering what they think is the process.

content: The human perspective cannot be commoditized, therefore it will always demand a premium.

content: Curiosity functions as an individual's filter for distinguishing signal from noise, and its effectiveness diminishes with increased distraction and numbness.

content: The skill stack of the future, or post-labor skill stack, is a hierarchy focused on skills that make creative output human, rather than career-specific skills that AI can perform.

name: The 'infinite library problem' describes a scenario where an overwhelming amount
content: The 'infinite library problem' describes a scenario where an overwhelming amount of information, like a library containing every possible book permutation, becomes effectively useless due to the statistical impossibility of finding meaningful content without curation or structure.

payload.content: Agency is the meta-skill of acting without permission or outside prompting, creating a unique story, and setting a life trajectory through billions of decisions that lead to acquiring knowledge.

content: Agency is the meta-skill of acting without permission or outside prompting, creating a unique story, and setting a life trajectory through billions of decisions that lead to acquiring knowledge.

content: Information without curation or structure is noise.

content: Curation and structure for information are derived from an individual's taste.

content: The 'infinite monkey problem' in the context of AI output refers to the generation of vast amounts of data without intention or selection, rendering the output meaningless despite potential accidental brilliance.

content: Agency is practiced through struggle, status, and curiosity.

content: Taste is the skill of discernment, which provides curation and structure to information, making it meaningful amidst the "infinite library problem" created by AI.

content: To develop taste, one must build something of their own, as taste is defined as the ability to discern what is worth keeping, and without personal control over this process, one is molded by the taste of others.

content: For a creative, curation is a more important skill than creation.

payload.content: Developmental psychology indicates that human values and worldviews progress through predictable stages over time, typically moving towards less conformist, ideological, and dogmatic thinking.

content: Developmental psychology indicates that human values and worldviews progress through predictable stages over time, typically moving towards less conformist, ideological, and dogmatic thinking.

payload.content: Expanding one's mind allows for the comprehension of higher-level systems and constructs, enabling the housing of greater complexity of thought without resorting to defense mechanisms.

content: Expanding one's mind allows for the comprehension of higher-level systems and constructs, enabling the housing of greater complexity of thought without resorting to defense mechanisms.

payload.content: A narrow perspective hinders the ability to curate and limits the value of one's taste.

content: A narrow perspective hinders the ability to curate and limits the value of one's taste.

payload.content: Approximately 50% of the population remains in a highly conformist stage of development, lacking the cognitive capacity for genuine agency and often conforming to the idea of high agency itself.

content: Approximately 50% of the population remains in a highly conformist stage of development, lacking the cognitive capacity for genuine agency and often conforming to the idea of high agency itself.

content: To increase capacity for greater perspective, one should allow themselves to become disoriented or knocked out of equilibrium and accept it as a new normal, rather than actively trying to 'level up' or doubling down on current perspectives.

content: Many people resolve pain or dissonance too quickly, often by adopting political opinions as absolute truth or faking higher developmental stages, which prevents genuine growth.

content: Creatives often fail to persuade others of the value of their work, mistakenly believing that simply creating or sounding intelligent is sufficient, when in reality, people only care if they understand how it benefits their lives.

content: In the modern world, unlike tribal societies where roles were assigned, individuals must actively exert effort to spread their work because even the best creations will not be seen or valued without understanding attention mechanisms like marketing and sales.

content: Art must merge with business to be successful in the current environment.

content: To become effective at anything, one must experiment, learn, and iterate until desired results are achieved.
